title: How to Make Spaghetti Pie

steps.headline: Cook spaghetti as directed on box.
steps.description: Should take about 6-10 minutes. Maybe set a timer so you don't forget about it while doing the following steps.

steps.headline: Dice onion and sauté in large saucepan using 1 tbs olive oil until onions appear translucent and flimsy.
steps.description: Place in large pot and set aside.

steps.headline: In the same saucepan, brown ground beef and sausage (can be done together or separately).
steps.description: When done cooking, drain grease and add to the onions in the large pot.

steps.headline: Add pasta sauce and tomato paste to the meat and onions in the large pot.
steps.description: Allow to simmer on low to medium heat, stirring occasionally, until needed later.

steps.headline: REMEMBER THE PASTA.
steps.description: When it's done cooking, drain it and return to pot.

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C) and grease the pie plates.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the ricotta, eggs and parmesan cheese.
steps.description: Mix to create cheese mixture. Slice the mozzarella thinly and set aside. The cheese mixture should have a consistency similar to ricotta itself but slightly creamier.

steps.headline: Combine 1.5 cups of cheese mixture to the cooked pasta.
steps.description: Be sure to coat the pasta evenly.

steps.headline: Form coated noodles into the crust in the pie plate.
steps.description: It should be fairly thick, enough so the pie plate is barely visible through the noodles.

steps.headline: Ladle 3 scoops of sauce into center of pie (this is like the filling).
Using the remaining cheese mixture, create a layer on top of the sauce.
steps.description: Arrange the mozzarella slices on top of cheese mixture.

steps.headline: Place pie plates on cookie sheets and place in oven for 45 minutes at 350 °F (177 °C).
Let cool 5-10 minutes so serving it is easier.
ENJOY!
steps.description: Freeze whatever you didn't eat for a hassle free meal another night.

text: Gather everything needed. See "ingredients" and "things you'll need" sections. Cook spaghetti as directed on box. Should take about 6-10 minutes. Maybe set a timer so you don't forget about it while doing the following steps. Dice onion and sauté in large saucepan using 1 tbs olive oil until onions appear translucent and flimsy. Place in large pot and set aside. In the same saucepan, brown ground beef and sausage (can be done together or separately). When done cooking, drain grease and add to the onions in the large pot. Add pasta sauce and tomato paste to the meat and onions in the large pot. Allow to simmer on low to medium heat, stirring occasionally, until needed later. REMEMBER THE PASTA. When it's done cooking, drain it and return to pot. Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C) and grease the pie plates.  In a large mixing bowl, combine the ricotta, eggs and parmesan cheese. Mix to create cheese mixture. Slice the mozzarella thinly and set aside. The cheese mixture should have a consistency similar to ricotta itself but slightly creamier. Combine 1.5 cups of cheese mixture to the cooked pasta. Be sure to coat the pasta evenly. Form coated noodles into the crust in the pie plate. It should be fairly thick, enough so the pie plate is barely visible through the noodles. Ladle 3 scoops of sauce into center of pie (this is like the filling).  Using the remaining cheese mixture, create a layer on top of the sauce. Arrange the mozzarella slices on top of cheese mixture. Place pie plates on cookie sheets and place in oven for 45 minutes at 350 °F (177 °C).  Let cool 5-10 minutes so serving it is easier.  ENJOY! Freeze whatever you didn't eat for a hassle free meal another night.
